caption: Spent 20 minutes crafting and placing an order online. This would've been our first time trying Oath. When we finally decided what we wanted and sent it in we were excited to see the results.  Fast forward the 20 minutes it took to walk over there. We step inside and head over to the employee. I tell him my name and he replies "Oh I refunded your order. We didn't have this gf dough or ice cream."  He could've called or something. Seemed to me he just didn't feel like making it. Poor service!
Awesome coliflower pizza

The pizza was super yummy, I tried the bella & it had a small sweetness to it that I loved. I think it was the balsamic drizzle. It was supposed to come with basil but I guess they forgot it on mine because I was expecting it to be green. If you like thin crust pizza you’ll really enjoy. The caesar salad that came with the combo was on the small side so if I came back, I’d just get the whole pizza. The staff was kind. This location didn’t have the lemon açaí soda even though it was on the menu online so I ended up just getting water. On a 10 point scale, I’d give the pizza an 8.5 & the salad a 2 lol
Right now, easily the best tasting pizza in the city. Even the crust is absolutely delicious.
Excellent pizza
ALWAYS Great pizza!! I can't eat mozerella so I love that I can choose a different cheese and still be able to enjoy the love of pizza! YUM😋
Pizza is tasty. Service is great.
Great pizza... loved the crust!
I really enjoy the vegan options and the selection of toppings. Excellent staff, friendly and efficient. Never had the slighest problem with an order.
Because of the hospitality and the service.

I have discovered Oath during quarantine. It has become my weekly delight. I’m doing everything in my power to not order twice a week. It’s so good with a perfect thin crust and delicious toppings (I typically do Italian sausage and mushroom). Trying to get the guts to order the cauliflower crust. Maybe next week.
This is my favorite pizza place!  The crust is the best I’ve every had!
Unique tasty crust, good sauce and toppings.  Love the chocolate chip cookies.
This was my first time there however it was clean, the staff was very polite and friendly, the pizza was delicious... I'm sure I'll go back again 👍🏽
It was a different type of pizza place from the mainstream.  Good stuff.

Right off the tube. Easy access. Quick and friendly service. Humanly raised/sourced meats. Great flavor. Affordable! Great portions. I had reviewed this on another account, that I barely use this place is so good I had to give it another 5 stars :-) please don't sue me! I don't work for them I just LOVE their pizza! Vegan options gluten free too! But they got lots of tasty meat

Food is delicious! You can really appreciate the fresh, high quality ingredients. Staff is extremely pleasant and friendly!! We try to make an effort to go here whenever we come into the area. If I could have anything to say that isn't positive it would be the music is a little loud to enjoy conversation but I'm a wee bit hard of hearing so it could just be me 😉 Other than that, zero complaints!! 😁

What a tasty, unique crust! Kind of reminds me of the savory doughnut on the Astro Doughnuts chicken sandwich, but thinner and crisper.  The pizzas take about 10 min to make and enough for 1-2 people. They have an app with rewards so make sure to download it!
Figgy pig
Delicious. Great price. Great service. Timely. Non gmo, humanely raised meats. Easy to find.
Just randomly walked in and very happy I did. Friendly and attentive staff and the pizza is great!
Great toppings and taste, the dough was just ok
Very tasty pizza and the customer service was great.   Love the veggies , roasted garlic tomato sauce, and the crispy crust.
First and Last time here, staff are Rude AF!
Everything is fantastic ESPECIALLY the dessert pizza!
My pizza was very charred.. it chipped as I broke it in slices the one star is for the bacon that was on it. 🤦🏽‍♀️😭
Super attentive and knowledgeable employees. The food is made to order with lots of care.
Lovely pizza, friendly staff would recommend
Not as expensive as I thought
Good pizza, friendly service
They have good pizza margherita at a decent prize - recommend it!
Thin crust is amazing!
Pizza and service were both top notch. We will definitely be back.

I walked into Oath Pizza late one evening, and was pleasantly surprised to see vegan options on the menu. The friendly staff gave good advice.  That vegan pizza was very good.  I recently returned and ordered a build-your-own vegan pie.  Oath has a wide selection of vegetables and plant based protein, to put together a tasty pie.  I was so impressed at how they put the pie together, I took a pic of it before it was baked.
Had the spicy mother clucker. Wasn’t the best or the worst spicy pizza I ever had.
Friendly staff and delicious pizza!
Damn good pizza
First time Customer. Good food, good price.
Great pizza great staff
Good fast pizza snd great salads
I’m vegan and love the crust and vegan cheese. The pizza I got today around 5pm at this location was some of the best pizza I’ve ever had! Two thumbs up!
I can get there slices under $10 and the 🍕 is delicious!!!!

They were terrible didn't know what things meant on the menu. The staff was young and not professional at all. I would never go back the salad was nothing but the end of salad just the stock it was terrible and I paid alot of money for a salad.
Good food and polite helpful servers .
I got half order of their pizza and Caesar salad. Both were good and tasted fresh.

I have enjoyed the pizza in the past so I give it two stars. However, most recently I couldn’t order anything even though I was the only person there. I waited for the person working to help me or say something to me for 10 or so minutes, but after I did get the person’s attention, they acknowledged me and walked to the back so I finally just walked out. It’s a shame because I’ve had a good experience there before.
Food was awesome the pizza was amazing
It is all about that crust. Like a perfectly toasted naan with well balanced toppings.
It's cool and nice place the customer Service is 1A
Very customizable. Vegetarian options easily available.
Love the pizza, very friendly service and clean
They have the best alternative to plastic straws I have seen anywhere in DC.  The pizza was incredible as well!
(Translated by Google) Delicious very good service !!!!  (Original) Delicioso muy buena atención !!!!
Service is fantastic, great pizza. Love Oath pizza!!

Don't hesitate: just go. When I first went to Oath a year ago it changed my stadards for thin crust pizza. A year later the quality hasn't faltered and now the management (I interacted with Eric, he's the man) has changed my standards for customer service. Fast, hospitable service that goes above and beyond. Quality ingredients, careful preparation, and unbeatable crust. Satisfying portions at a fair price and you can't go wrong with any of the Stubborn Sodas on tap. If nothing else, I urge you to give Oath a try, I'm confident your experience will speak for itself.
Absolutely amazing customer service, and the pizza is really good.
They are amazing and friendly! Always A1 when I come in!
This place has some amazing pizza an good  customer service.
Great pizza and such amazing service!
Love this place awesome pizza!

Really interesting pizza concept and soda selection. All I can tell u is u gotta try it. U can get a half or a whole. Staff was nice and welcoming. Bathrooms were super nice. Wish they had more locations.
Great thin crust pizza and good salads.
Love the  build your own gourmet pizzas!
Pizza was hella good.. but, it took a bit to order even though there weren't many folks in line. Overall that's come out to average, almost four stars.
A different take on "fast pizza" with premium ingredients and a nice crispy crust.

Stopped by here on the way into nats park. I had a mozzarella, ricotta, and feta pizza and a beer...the pizza was great, the crust is something to experience. My son said it may be the best he's ever had.  It is a thin crust and grilled in avocado oil.  Delicious.

I am genuinely shocked at the good reviews at this place, as this was by far the worst pizza I have ever had in D.C. (arguably anywhere). It was more expensive than any of the other similar restaurants, the crust was so thin and gross that I felt like i was literally eating cardboard with sauce. I implore all of you wonderful Google readers to avoid this place and spend your money elsewhere. (Bethesda Bagels next door is always a good choice.)

The atmosphere is nice.  The service great.  The pizza... Well, dry and tasteless for the price I paid.  It's almost like the place tries too hard to be different, sacrificing basic good pizza norms.  Norms like, taste., Try it for yourself, you may like it and again, the service was good.
Fantastic pizza! Staff are friendly and treat customers well. My new favorite pizza spot.

Had a great experience here for a late lunch. Ordered a half-pizza that was well made, and the perfect amount to eat (I could see if you're really hungry you'd want to order a whole pizza). Craft soft drinks on tap were also very tasty. When this location is busy you might not be able to find a seat, so plan accordingly for your lunch or dinner. Worth checking out.
Very light pizza, recommend doing a while pizza if your hungry.
Great pizza. It's city prices but you get what you pay for, a delicious pie.

Came in for lunch and it was pretty busy, long wait time. Pizza was okay, kind of dry and on the expensive side for the amount of topping. Young man at the register was unable to hear me over the noise and loud music in the restaurant and rudely asked me to 'slow down and talk louder'.  20 minutes later an employee brings us our pizzas without saying a word. Not worth the time and money, pick somewhere that cares about what they do.
Good pizza. Use the app to order ahead.
Meh... Nothing to write home about
It is a unique taste pizza i loved it
The avocado oil crust is awesome! Build your own with whatever toppings you like.
Good pizza, served hot and quickly, price is ok for small size.

My least favorite pizza I’ve ever had. Extremely thin and dry with almost no toppings. Not sure how you mess up pizza that badly.  Only gets a second star for the speed of service for my online order.

Do not order online!  I wanted something to quickly order and pickup but my "selfie" was made completely wrong... No sauce, half of the toppings not on it, and some added that I did not want. It was crispy and light, but that was the only redemption from this experience.
WOW!!!! The pizza is soooooo good. The place was very very clean and the staff is super nice ....Great prices ...I will DEFINITELY eat here again!
Great speciality pizza!!!
Good food, good ingredients, good flavor. Custom made but fast.
I loved the atmosphere and the general vibe of the place. The pizza was very good and about the right size for a single person.

We popped into Oath because the menu looked interesting and it was in a convenient location to where we were staying while visiting the neighborhood. Before you go definitely sign up for their loyalty program. You get 50% off your first pizza and then you can cancel right away. Totally worth it.  Oath is a fast fire pizza place that's a bit fancier than most of the other ones I've run stopped in. They have a couple of gourmet pizzas pre-designed or you can build your own. We tried The David and the Muffled Trushroom. Ordering was quick and painless and we only waited about five minutes for our pizzas to be done. The half pizzas were cut into 3 slices each and honestly felt a little small compared to other places like this. However both of them tasted delicious. The flavors were wonderful and all complimented each other nicely. It felt pretty fancy for a "fast food" place.  I wish there were a few more options on their menu like sides or desserts, but if they want to focus on pizza and do it well that's fine too. If we're every back in the area we'd stop in again, but this time we'd order full pizzas so we wouldn't leave hungry!
Good flavor, thin crust.  Good value for lunch.
Delicious pizza, especially the crispy crust
Nice the cheapest, but the quality shows. It's a delight, and bathed in wonderful light through an all glass facade
nice pizza spot in navy yard. delicious.
Nice to have a half as an option. Nice and crispy crusts, super staff!
Great place. Good pizza and customer service. More like ethical service.
Pizza is great but ordering is a nightmare. If you call it in they either lose your order or get really confused for some reason. The online order feature never works either.

We came on a Thursday night during a storm. No one else was there. The food was decent just like their other locations but the people there definitely acted like they didn't want to be there at all. No friendly conversation or personality like the mosaic district location. But it was clean, quick, and good.
Online ordering has never worked since they opened. Service is generally not very friendly and not quick. I like the pizza though.
Online ordering has been broken on their website at this location for weeks and they refuse to take orders on the phone, idiotic process. Can't wait til this place is out of business/replaced.
Crust is Awesome! Light..crispy..and Good
Love the David. Some of the tastiest pizza I ever had. Great price for the amount. Just watch the calories haha.
Pizza was decent, thier meats are not all the great of quality but the overall taste is decent, not worth the money in my opinion still decent tho
Pizza is good. Service SUCKS. Guy at the front desk was rude, not friendly and barely said anything to us when we asked him a question. Will not go back.
I prdered last time and it was great. Thin and crispy. Today i made a selfie. And i had many toppings including potatoes but all ivgot was potatoes and a loaded soggy pizza that was inedible.
Delicious pizza and fast delivery. Thin crust with options to please everyone.

We visited this location with 4 adults and 4 children and could not have made a better decision! Everyone enjoyed their pizzas and the less hectic atmosphere. I typically order my pizzas with all meat (think Meat-lovers or Carnivores) but since it was something new, I decided to live outside of my comfort zone and ordered the Dougie. I was shocked with how good it was and it may lead me to rethink my future pizza decisions.  I removed 1 star for two minor reasons. 1) The lack of familiar soda options available.  The temperatures that day we're exceeding 90° and I was definitely looking forward to having an ice cold Coke. I had the "draft cola" (I think that's what it was called) and it was decent but definitely wasn't what I was craving. 2) The staff wasn't very friendly. I'm not asking for a Chick-fil-a ("my pleasure") level interaction but none of the people working seemed to understand or care about how their apathetic "just a job" demeanor can impact the overall experience.  Ultimately, we were all pleasantly surprised and would definitely visit this or any other Oath Pizza location in the future!
Pizza was so good
Excellent pizza.  A great new go to place before a Nationals game.

So they said to use DoorDash but I make an order for the pizza because I’m vegan and I’m in town for a concert working and I just need some pizza I order it and 15 minutes into the order they cancel the order which is stupid time consuming and horrible I don’t know why they would cancel the order and door dash doesn’t know why they canceled the order  I just needed a lovely pizza And this really sucks do you think they would at least call you back and say hey we’re sorry we don’t deliver or we’re closed or whatever but unacceptable it’s 5pm on a Thursday

Great pizza with some of the best crust I've had. Similar experience as &pizza where you can build your own custom pizza or select a signature pizza from the menu. Quickly baked and served. Highly recommend to anyone looking to satisfy a pizza craving. Dine in or take out.
I would like to be served pizza by people who actually do not like to show their underwear to the world. I know this a fad but I’m not paying pizza and a show.

Went in this evening for the first time and ordered a small pepperoni.  While the pizza was tasty and good for the price, the guy making the pizza had a nasty attitude.  I walked in and he didn't even greet me.  Then looked at me like do you need something? Then he said " The register is over there "   When I asked him why he greeted the 2 people that walked in after me and not me, his response was "I wasn't paying attention."  Just ignorant.
Thin crusted pizza? Without the painful crunch? Sign me up.
Really good pizza!
Extremely good pizza and great staff!
Great pizza, my coworker had to stop going there so she wouldn't put on weight. The vegan options are good too
Great pizza. Not oily at all. Rather, it is refreshing.I should visit it again when I come next time.
Near metro, fresh pizza and good vibe!

With the infiltration of &pizza, I thought all pizza brands were scared off, but I was wrong. Within months of each other, three different pizza shops opened in the Navy Yard including Oath Pizza.  My Monday night dinner buddy and I checked it out, of course, on a Monday at 6pm. We were one of four people there making us think they are banking on the Nationals crowd supporting their business. If you don't care about eating the best pizza in DC, you're in luck.  Oath Pizza serves custom and suggested for you personal pizzas. An eleven inch pizza cost just under $12. I made my own pizza with tomato sauce, cheese, sausage, garlic, and spice aioli. It came out within 6 minutes and it was meh. The crust was super thin, which makes it easier to burn and they did. It was slightly burned and too crunchy. It also lacked flavor.  On the plus side, the space is beautiful with interesting wall art, posters, and plenty of seating. The staff is friendly and they have good soda (and chocolate chip cookies for dessert). If you want to eat healthier, they create seasonal salads.  If you care about getting the best pizza in town, walk to nearby All Purpose or venture to Eastern Market for Seventh Hill. Even &pizza on Barracks Row is a better option.

Highly distinctive crust. Ingredients aren’t piled as high as some places. In other words, a distinctive style that you’ll either appreciate or not, but that most people seem to really like (judging from in person interaction. I guess a reviewer got their crust burned,  but I didn’t see any burned in the couple of dozen I’ve watched coming out, so it appears they had bad luck.)
Really nice Service the pizza is light but tasteful!!!

The pizza is delicious. I like the vegan crust. Only thing... On my first visit, I built my own pizza. I paid for it, and was able to go down the line to choose my toppings. The process was quick and easy.  My next visit, I built my own pizza. But, I had to tell the cashier everything I wanted on my pizza and wait for him to ring up all of the toppings. And then, they made my pizza.  The first experience was much better. But, the staff have all been very friendly. And a again, the pizza is great with plenty of toppings to choose from.

Great thin crust pizza at a reasonable price-point! Service was quick and thoughtful. Atmosphere was laid back, great music was playing, and staff members continuously tidied up spaces so that guest felt welcomed. We are so glad to have this place in our neighborhood!
